hallucinations.text: You hear your name whispered. Soft, insistent. Coming from everywhere and nowhere.
Voices emerge from the static. They're speaking in a language you almost recognize. Almost understand.
Footsteps behind you. Heavy. Deliberate. You turn around. Nothing. The footsteps stop when you stop.
A child is crying somewhere nearby. The sound is muffled, distant. You can't tell which direction it's coming from.
The radio crackles to life even though it's off. Dead voices speaking in overlapping fragments. 'Help us.' 'Too late.' 'It's here.'
You hear breathing. Slow, wet, labored. It's coming from inside the walls.
The aurora is singing. High, crystalline notes that make your bones vibrate. Beautiful and terrible.
Something is scratching at the door. Slow, methodical. Like it's trying to remember how doors work.
You hear your own voice calling out from another room. But you're here. You didn't say anything.
A deep, subsonic hum that you feel more than hear. It resonates in your chest cavity. The Entity is near.
